remarks: Defining ` E. x ph ` given decidability.  It is common in classical logic to define ` E. x ph ` as ` -. A. x -. ph ` but in intuitionistic logic without a decidability condition, that is only an implication not an equivalence, as seen at ~ exalim .  (Contributed by Jim Kingdon, 15-Mar-2018.)
statement: dfexdc $p |- ( DECID E. x ph -> ( E. x ph <-> -. A. x -. ph ) ) $.
